H0.text: What was the top speed in miles per hour of the first ever train. 30 mph

H1.text: What was the top speed in miles per hour of the first ever train. 5 mph

H2.text: What was the top speed in miles per hour of the first ever train. 60 mph

H3.text: What was the top speed in miles per hour of the first ever train. 18,000 mph

A4.text: Demonstrations also saw Rocket consistently and easily haul a carriage with over 20 persons up the Whiston Incline at over 15 mph (24 km/h), and light engine running of around 30 mph (48 km/h).

A5.text: Rocket passed the trial requirement of achieving an average speed of 10 mph (16 km/h) over 70 miles (110 km) by over 40 percent.
